taskbody.context:
On the Create organization page, you can create an organization and specify its role (technology provider, supplier, reseller, broker, or - implicitly - customer only). For every new organization, you must define a user who is to become its first administrator. This user can later register new users and assign roles to them.
Depending on the role of the organization to be created, different fields are mandatory. For example, if you create a customer organization by specifying no role at all, this organization must be assigned a marketplace. The marketplace must already exist. For organizations with other roles, no marketplace assignment is required.
User authentication and managementThe platform supports the following authentication modes:
INTERNAL mode - users are authenticated against the platform: User IDs and passwords of an organization are created and maintained in the platform or in an existing LDAP system of the organization.
When maintained in the platform, the user data is stored in the platform's database. An organization's administrator can register new users, and, if required, request passwords to be reset by the operator.
When using an LDAP system, an organization does not need to register its users manually with the platform. The organization's administrator can import the users from the LDAP system, thus automatically registering them with the platform. The users are managed in the LDAP system. The platform continuously synchronizes its information on the users. Connection settings have to be defined in a configuration file so that the platform can connect to the LDAP system.
A mixture of maintaining users in the platform and in the LDAP system is not supported. In addition, the type of user management can no longer be changed once an organization has been created.
The operator organization cannot use an external LDAP system. So you can always log in to the platform and change connection settings, for example if the LDAP system of an organization is not available and thus authentication against it is not possible.
You can define default LDAP configuration settings for the entire platform. The settings in an organization's LDAP configuration file complement or replace the default settings.
SAML_SP mode - users are authenticated against an external authentication system (SAML 2.0 IdP): User IDs and passwords of an organization are created and maintained in the IdP. The platform acts as SAML 2.0 service provider.
For enabling users to access the platform, they must exist in the IdP and be registered with the same user ID with the platform.
In addition to using a platform-wide, so-called "default" IdP, you can define tenants to which different IdPs can be associated. By associating a tenant with an organization, the emails sent to the users of the organization will contain the URL of a marketplace or an administration portal of this tenant. By using this URL, users access a tenant-specific marketplace or administration portal, and all users are authenticated authenticated against the IdP of this tenant. Each organization can be associated with one tenant only. Different organizations can be associated with one and the same tenant. User IDs must be unique within the scope of the tenant. If no other tenant is defined, user names must be unique within the scope of the default tenant, i.e. platform-wide.
To create a new organization:

step.cmd: Enter the following user data for the first administrator of the new organization.

ul.li: Title: Salutation, such as MR or MS
First name: The administrator's first name.
Last name: The administrator's last name.

Email: Email address of the organization's administrator. Notifications about the creation of the account and access information will be sent to this address.
The system checks whether the syntax of the given email address is valid, and whether the domain name corresponds to the standards as defined and maintained by the Internet Assigned Numbers Authority (IANA).
Examples: user.name@domain.arpa, user.name@domain.org, user@mycompany.lan.uk

Desired user ID: User ID of the organization's administrator. User IDs are restricted to 100 characters and must not contain any of the following characters:
! " # $ % & ' * + , / : ; < = > ? \ ^ `

Language: Language in which the administrator will work by default. The user interface, available documentation, and emails will be presented to the administrator in the language specified here. The list of available languages depends on the languages you registered and activated. Click here for details.

info.note:
If the platform is installed in INTERNAL authentication mode and you create an organization with LDAP-based user management, the user ID must match an existing ID in the external LDAP system. The organization's LDAP configuration determines which additional settings are required. All settings defined in the configuration must be mapped to corresponding values, for example first name, last name, email address, and language.
If the platform is installed in SAML_SP authentication mode, the user ID must match an existing ID in the IdP.

step.cmd: Decide which roles are to be assigned to the organization by selecting the corresponding check boxes in the Organization role section. You can assign multiple roles to the organization. If you do not select any of the provided roles, the organization will receive the customer role. In this case, you must specify the marketplace to which the customer organization will be directed.
step.info: The reseller and broker roles cannot be combined with each other or with the technology provider or supplier role.

step.cmd: Enter the organization's additional data. Depending on the role of the organization to be created, different fields are available, and different entries are mandatory.

ul.li: Organization. Name of the organization, for example the company name.

Email. Email address for general communication with the organization. The organization can later specify a separate email address to which invoices can be sent.
The system checks whether the syntax of the given email address is valid, and whether the domain name corresponds to the standards as defined and maintained by the Internet Assigned Numbers Authority (IANA).
Examples: user.name@domain.arpa, user.name@domain.org, user@mycompany.lan.uk
Phone. Telephone or mobile number of a contact person in the organization.
Website. URL of the organization's website. This website can be accessed by customers when displaying details of the organization that offers a service they want to subscribe to.
Language: Default language used in the organization.
Address of the organization. The organization's administrator can later specify a different address to be printed on invoices.
Country where the organization is located.

Description: Description of the organization, for example information from the company's profile.
Make sure to use only the controls provided in the editor for formatting your text. Manually entered HTML tags and references to external style sheets or content may result in errors in the page layout.
Marketplace to which users of this organization are to be directed. You can select one of the marketplaces to which you have been granted access by the marketplace owner.

li.p: If the platform is installed in SAML_SP authentication mode: Tenant. By associating a tenant with an organization, the emails sent to the users of the organization will contain the URL of a marketplace or an administration portal of this tenant. Tenants must have been created beforehand on the Manage tenants page. The Marketplace drop-down list then offers all marketplaces associated with the tenant.
If you leave this field empty, the URL will point to the default tenant.

ul.li: For a supplier organization: Default operator rev. share (%). This is the revenue share agreed between the operator and the supplier, which the operator is to receive from the supplier for selling services on the marketplaces managed on the operator's platform. The default operator revenue share applies to all services offered by the supplier as long as you do not define a service-specific revenue share using the Manage operator revenue share menu option in the Operation menu. It also applies irrespective of whether the supplier sells his services himself, or uses brokers or resellers for selling them. Discounts granted by a supplier to his customers are deducted from the revenue share. Revenue shares and discounts are calculated only for services applying the platform's native billing system of . Services using an external billing system are not included in the calculation.

For a technology provider, supplier, reseller, and/or broker organization:
Profile image: Image used on a marketplace. The profile image is shown as soon as a customer requests details of a service provided by this organization.
Click in the Upload image field or click Browse, and select the file containing the desired image. Supported file formats are GIF, JPG, and PNG. The maximum size of the profile image is 154 x 154 pixels. The recommended size is 154 x 60 pixels.

step.cmd: Define if the organization is to use LDAP-based user management by selecting the corresponding checkbox.
step.info:
This option is not available if the platform is installed in SAML-SP authentication mode. When enabled, a table with the LDAP settings defined for the platform is shown. You must then specify the LDAP configuration file containing the settings required for connecting with the organization's LDAP system:
Create an LDAP configuration file on your file system, and define the LDAP connection settings in the file. To load the configuration file, click the LDAP settings entry field or Browse, and select the file containing the settings.
Here is a sample configuration file:
LDAP_BASE_DN=ou\=people,dc\=est,dc\=mycompany,dc\=de LDAP_CONTEXT_FACTORY=com.sun.jndi.ldap.LdapCtxFactory LDAP_URL=ldap://myldapserver.lan.est.company.de:389 LDAP_ATTR_UID=uid LDAP_ATTR_LAST_NAME=sn LDAP_ATTR_FIRST_NAME=givenName LDAP_ATTR_EMAIL=scalixEmailAddress LDAP_ATTR_REFERRAL=ignore
The defaults shown in the sample are defined for LDAP_CONTEXT_FACTORY and LDAP_ATTR_UID, i.e. if you do not specify a value, this default applies when creating the organization unless you have defined different ones in the default LDAP settings for the platform (Manage LDAP settings menu option).

step.cmd: To save your entries, click Save.

result.p: The organization is created with the specified administrator account. The administrator is notified by email that his account has been created. The email contains the URL for accessing the platform or the marketplace, as well as a user ID and password for the first login.
If the administrator's organization uses an external authentication system:

ul.li: Passwords are managed in this system. Therefore, the administrator is sent an email without a password. The password stored in the external authentication system must be used for logging in.

If the user ID of the administrator already exists in the platform, his email address (e.g. userSmith@organization.com) is used as user ID for logging in to the system. If yet another organization is created and the user ID of the administrator is again identical, the new user ID is constructed using the existing ID followed by the "at" sign (@) and the ID of the administrator's organization (e.g. userSmith@abcdefg). The administrator is sent an email with the respective user ID.

result.p: The default organizational unit of the organization is also created. The administrator is the first member of this default unit. Any user who will be registered for the organization is automatically added to the default unit. Additional units can be created by the administrators of the organization.
